Posts.Content: Dear Lucy B; thanks for sharing; yes it’s a lot to take and it’s good to remain positive. You will have much more information after surgery. Please keep us up to date - I like your attitude “ sad but not broken” wishing you all the best xxx
Posts.Title: Test Results

Posts.Content: Dear Jo, Many thanks for taking time to respond to my message - much appreciated. I will definitely have a look around for groups locally. Have a good evening . Big hugs  Pauline xx
Posts.Title: Coffee support groups

Posts.Content: Hi Minty, Having read your message, re length of time it takes to commence Radiotherapy, I read the message I've posted and noticed that I'd made an error. Apology for the above. I'm about to start chemotherapy on Thursday not Radiotherapy.  Can you please  confirm if you've lost your hair? Or did you use the cooling cap?  and did you experience a lot of side effects? Have a good day - big hugs xxxx

Posts.Content: Dear Boobylou,  manh thanks for you lovely  warm message much appreciate. The warm welcome and support is amazing. I due to commence my Chemo on Thursday and it's scary - really worried about the side effects and losing my hair.  Have a good day and big hugs xxx

Posts.Content: Good morning Kaccabg,  many thanks for you welcome message much appreciate. I'll be starti chemo on Thursday and I'm really worried about the terrible side effects.  Good luck with your Radiotherap. Do let me know how you get on. Have a good day. Best wishes Eden xx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi Cannon, lovely to hear from you and your kind message. Apology for the error in my initial message - the message should have stated that I'm due to commence Chemo and not Radiotherapy as stated in my initial messag.  How did you cope with chemo? havd you lost your hair?. The cooling cap was mentioned to me- I willl know more when I returned tomorrow for the "talk". Are you recovering well?  have a good day and big hugs xxx Pauline
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Good morning to you lovely and wonderful "club members". Many thanks for your warm welcome and messages, much appreciate.  Having read the messages I noticed that I have made an error in my initial message sent, I mentioned starting Radiotherapy as opposed to chemotharapy.  I had surgery on 13th June this year to remove the lump I found in my breast.  It was Stage 1 and a Grade 3 and no spreading to the lymph nodes.  I was told that the cancer is estrogen receptor.  I'm due to commence chemotherapy on Thursday and will have Radiotherapy after chemotherapy is finishe.  I will be prescribed Letrozole tablet.  I am really scared of the side effects to be had from chemotherapy. Many thanks for your kind messages  big hugs xxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Dear all, hope you're all having a good weekend. I am new on the site and looking to communite, ask questions. I am due to commence radiotherapy next week. I currently living in Bromley (Kent, it would be lovely to hear from you.   Many thanks  Eden xxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi Karen, Lovely to hear from you and your kind words much appreciated. I found the lump in my breast in May - had surgery on the 13th June's - Stage 1 cancer and Grade 3.- no cancer was found in my lymph nodes.  My cancer is "estrogen receptors". I am due to commence Chemo this Thursday - I'm worried about the side effects and losing my hair.  I'm still in shock regarding the above.   I'm self employed and at the moment I'm not working but if I can tolerate the Chemo I will start looking for a job. Have a good day and hope to hear from you again. Have a good day - big hugs xxxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Hi Minty,  many thanks for your re to my message, much appreciate.  I'm due to commence chemotherapy on Thursday  which will be followed by Radiotherapy- so I'm not able to answer the question asked about the time to began Radiotherapy after chemotherap.  I'm really scared of the side effects to be had from having chemotherap. Did you use the cooling cap durining chemotherap? Have you lost your hair?  When do y start your Radiotherap? Good luck and remain positive  - Pauline xx
Posts.Title: Hello, I am new, anyone there?

Posts.Content: Congratulations re the outcome of your treatment ... have a  fab Christmas and all the best  for 2018 Kind regards Eden
Posts.Title: Mri results

Posts.Content: Dear Phaedra many thanks to you and all the lovely ladies for your kind words - much appreciated.  Well done for completing three sessions of Chemo - hope it is going well for you. I've just been given medication inclusive of ant- sickness meds-  I'll take your advice and take the anti- sickness drugs prior to feeling sick.  Best wishes - and lots of love for your next treatment  Pauline xx

Posts.Content: Good morning ladies,  I am at the hospital to commence my first Chemo Treatment- my cooling cap is now on my head - not sure what to expect - i am a bit scared of the pending side effects. Muzza and Kerry - your messages touched my hart regarding crying as I find myslf crying occasionally .   Big hugs   Pauline xxx
